subsection.name: Description
subsection.div: Allows to specify what warnings that @SuppressWarnings is not allowed to suppress. You can also specify a list of TokenTypes that the configured warning(s) cannot be suppressed on.
subsection.p: Limitations: This check does not consider conditionals inside the @SuppressWarnings annotation.
By default, any warning specified will be disallowed on all legal TokenTypes unless otherwise specified via the tokens property.
Also, by default warnings that are empty strings or all whitespace (regex: ^$|^\s+$) are flagged. By specifying, the format property these defaults no longer apply.
This check can be configured so that the "unchecked" and "unused" warnings cannot be suppressed on anything but variable and parameter declarations. See below of an example.

tr.td: Specify the RegExp to match against warnings. Any warning being suppressed matching this pattern will be flagged.

subset of tokens
CLASS_DEF , INTERFACE_DEF , ENUM_DEF , ANNOTATION_DEF , ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF , ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF , PARAMETER_DEF , VARIABLE_DEF , METHOD_DEF , CTOR_DEF , COMPACT_CTOR_DEF , RECORD_DEF , PATTERN_VARIABLE_DEF .

CLASS_DEF , INTERFACE_DEF , ENUM_DEF , ANNOTATION_DEF , ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF , ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF , PARAMETER_DEF , VARIABLE_DEF , METHOD_DEF , CTOR_DEF , COMPACT_CTOR_DEF , RECORD_DEF , PATTERN_VARIABLE_DEF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check so that the "unchecked" and "unused" warnings cannot be suppressed on anything but variable and parameter declarations.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="SuppressWarnings"> <property name="format" value="^unchecked$|^unused$"/> <property name="tokens" value=" CLASS_DEF,INTERFACE_DEF,ENUM_DEF, ANNOTATION_DEF,ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF, ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF,METHOD_DEF,CTOR_DEF "/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
